channel.title: interview on Cho-Nan Tsai CTO media interviews, essays and talks
channel.description: Recent content in interview on Cho-Nan Tsai CTO media interviews, essays and talks

item.title: Columbia Venture Community: Why you will fail to build a great social impact startup
item.description: About the Talk For a startup founder in the impact space, it is not that difficult to just build a company. There are so many technology tools that can help a startup in the initiation phase. It almost cost just a fraction of what it used to be 10 years ago, both in terms of time and resources, to bring a product to market for validation. However, it is challenging to build a GREAT company that can make a dent in this entropic universe we live in.

item.title: The Wire China Interview: About Beijing startup scene
item.description: Media Interview Recently, I was interviewed for an article in The Wire China about my Beijing startup experience in 2015. Read the full article here.

item.title: Challenges and Opportunities in Property Tech
item.description: A few weeks ago, I was invited to be a guest on a high profile fintech podcast called Hitechies. It was fantastic to speak with the host, Pramod Dhakal, who is based in Belgium. We talked casually how I started in fintech with Camino Financial, then how I transitioned to proptech in the midst of the pandemic. I touched on how blockchain is revolutionizing the real estate space and my outlook on the future of crypto, online lending and fintech in general.

item.title: Preparing for a career in fintech: A conversation with Cho-Nan Tsai, a Fintech CTO
item.description: I recently gave an interview on the topic of career preparation in fintech. The interview was conducted by Trilogy Education Service which is the company that’s running Fintech Bootcamp program at Columbia Unviersity. The entire interview is here. The article/interview was published in summer 2021 on Columbia Engineering School Bootcamp Program website

item.title: Master Class - Building a career in software
item.description: About the Class With professional experiences in high-flying Fortune 500 companies and tiny nobody start-ups, this battle-scarred CTO shares his wisdom from his journey on becoming a professional software engineer. In this class, you will learn tips to help you navigate this fun-filled, exciting career. 1. American dream Not your typical American dream. 2. Knowing your passion Developing a true passion can make a giant difference in your career. 3. Choosing a programming language So, which one?

item.title: Crafting a Life-Changing Tech Internship Experience
item.description: Slides PDF About the Talk Every great career begins with a dream. However, that alone is often not enough. A dreamer must be given the opportunity to try, to fail and to succeed. In 1999, I was fortunate enough to go to Tokyo for a summer internship. Thatâ€™s where I met Joi Ito, got exposed to open source software for the first time and much more. It was a life-changing experience and even today I continue to cherish it.

item.title: Lainto Coalition
item.description: At a panel, discussing the importance of cybersecurity for small- and mid-size businesses.
